text: hi guys today I'm making a very fancy
cookie it's a Madeleine they're made in
these pans and really the only fancy
thing about them is the pan they're
really a little I would say them more
like a little cake and you start off
with six eggs get your six eggs into a
mixer with one cup of sugar and two
tablespoons of light brown sugar
that's for flavor you can just do all
white sugar if you want to and now what
you need to do is beat this or whisk it
for about ten minutes it needs to whisk
until it's really really increased in
volume and it's very light and fluffy
that can take up to ten minutes and in
the meanwhile you can get your dry
ingredients ready two cups of
all-purpose flour you are getting a lot
of your volume from the meat and eggs
but just for safety a little bit of
baking powder one teaspoon and
three-quarters of a teaspoon salt give
that a whisk
I'd like to say that you can walk away
but sometimes when you're beating things
for a really long time your mixer ends
up on the floor so you have to give it
you have to keep an eye on it it's
happens when you guys I'm not joking I'm
not exaggerating it's real I need a
couple more ingredients my mixture as
you can see is really increased in
volume very very very light and very
fluffy and it'll hold a ribbon a little
bit and then it sinks backed in takes
about five seconds for it to sink back
in then you know it's done take that off
you want to do is sip the dry

about three additions you're trying to
maintain as much of the lightness as

ingredients so sift folds if folds if
fold
you don't have to fully incorporate it
before you add your next addition so
that you don't lose too much volume okay
fold those in and then when you're going

you'll find that it sort of sits around

three-quarters of a teaspoon of vanilla

nice and tender about two hours all
right
refrigerated and then I took it out for
about ten minutes just to come to room

need to be buttered so have some
softened butter on hand and generously
butter your pans it's less important
that it be very well buttered if you're
using the nonstick ones which do exist
and you can get those Madeleine pans
have all these little ridges and you
want to make sure that each one of them
is fully buttered and a good way to do
that is by using a pastry brush like I

very nice softened butter okay fully

matter what size your pan have your oven

like little cakes when they taste like
little cakes too you want to get these
in the oven and bake until they're light

11 minutes so they're just very light

is pretty much turn them right out while

warm if you're not going to eat these
